question: Mark Smith purchased a green bond issued by Coca-Cola for $7827. The bond offers an annual yield of 5.35% compounded annually over 3 years. Calculate the total interest earned from this green bond investment.
solution:
Step 1: Compute the future value of the investment:
  Future Value = Principal × (1 + Yield Rate/100)^Time
               = 7827 × (1 + 0.0535)^3 = 9151.64

Step 2: Determine the interest earned:
  Interest Earned = Future Value - Principal
                  = 9151.64 - 7827 = 1324.64

question: Emily White invested in a green bond issued by Walmart for $27413 at an annual coupon rate of 5.59% compounded annually over 7 years. In addition, due to sustainable finance benefits, the investor receives a tax credit of 6.95% on the interest earned. Furthermore, Walmart achieves annual energy cost savings of $1035, for which the investor gets a synergy bonus of $30.48 per $500 saved each year. Moreover, the investor reinvests 14.06% of the annual interest at an additional rate of 2.36% compounded annually. Calculate the total net benefit to the investor by summing the compound interest, tax credit, synergy bonus, and reinvestment gains.
solution:
Step 1: Compute the compound interest from the green bond:
  Future Value = 27413 × (1 + 0.0559)^7 = 40115.86
  Interest Earned = Future Value - Principal = 40115.86 - 27413 = 12702.86

Step 2: Calculate the tax credit on the interest earned:
  Tax Credit = Interest Earned × (Tax Credit Rate/100) = 12702.86 × (6.95/100) = 882.85

Step 3: Determine the synergy bonus from energy cost savings:
  Bonus per Year = (Annual Savings / 500) × Synergy Bonus Rate = (1035 / 500) × 30.48 = 63.09
  Total Bonus over 7 years = 63.09 × 7 = 441.66

Step 4: Compute the reinvestment benefit:
  Annual Interest = Interest Earned / Time = 12702.86 / 7 = 1814.69
  Reinvestment Amount per Year = (Reinvestment Percentage/100) × Annual Interest = (14.06/100) × 1814.69 = 255.15
  Reinvestment Benefit = Sum (for each year i from 1 to 7) of [Reinvested Amount × (1 + 0.0236)^(Time - i)] = 1917.57

Step 5: Calculate the Total Net Benefit:
  Total Net Benefit = Interest Earned + Tax Credit + Total Bonus + Reinvestment Benefit
                    = 12702.86 + 882.85 + 441.66 + 1917.57 = 15944.93

question: David Brown invested in a green bond issued by Apple for $22111 at an annual coupon rate of 5.46% compounded annually over 5 years. As a result of energy efficiency measures financed by the bond, Apple achieves annual cost savings of $3519. Additionally, the investor receives a synergy bonus of $23.16 for every $500 saved annually. Calculate the total net benefit to the investor, including both the compound interest and the synergy bonus.
solution:
Step 1: Calculate the compound interest earned:
  Future Value = 22111 × (1 + 0.0546)^5 = 28843.45
  Interest Earned = Future Value - Principal = 28843.45 - 22111 = 6732.45

Step 2: Determine the annual synergy bonus:
  Bonus per Year = (Annual Savings / 500) × Bonus Rate = (3519 / 500) × 23.16 = 163.0

Step 3: Compute the total synergy bonus over 5 years:
  Total Bonus = Bonus per Year × Time = 163.0 × 5 = 815.0

Step 4: Calculate the total net benefit:
  Total Net Benefit = Interest Earned + Total Bonus = 6732.45 + 815.0 = 7547.45

question: Emily White is evaluating a green bond issued by Microsoft with a principal of $29356 and an annual coupon rate of 4.62% compounded annually over 4 years. Due to sustainable finance incentives, the effective interest rate is reduced by 0.76 percentage points. Calculate the financing cost reduction in terms of the difference in compound interest between the original and the discounted rates.
solution:
Step 1: Original calculation:
  Original Future Value = 29356 × (1 + 0.0462)^4 = 35168.65
  Original Interest = 35168.65 - 29356 = 5812.65

Step 2: Adjust the interest rate:
  Adjusted Rate = 4.62 - 0.76 = 3.8600000000000003%

Step 3: Adjusted calculation:
  Adjusted Future Value = 29356 × (1 + 0.0386)^4 = 34157.82
  Adjusted Interest = 34157.82 - 29356 = 4801.82

Step 4: Financing cost reduction:
  Cost Reduction = Original Interest - Adjusted Interest = 5812.65 - 4801.82 = 1010.83

question: Emily White invested in a green bond issued by General Electric for $38405 at an annual coupon rate of 4.11% compounded annually over 4 years. In addition, due to sustainable finance benefits, the investor receives a tax credit of 6.34% on the interest earned. Furthermore, General Electric achieves annual energy cost savings of $1946, for which the investor gets a synergy bonus of $45.42 per $500 saved each year. Moreover, the investor reinvests 13.32% of the annual interest at an additional rate of 5.18% compounded annually. Calculate the total net benefit to the investor by summing the compound interest, tax credit, synergy bonus, and reinvestment gains.
solution:
Step 1: Compute the compound interest from the green bond:
  Future Value = 38405 × (1 + 0.0411)^4 = 45118.8
  Interest Earned = Future Value - Principal = 45118.8 - 38405 = 6713.8

Step 2: Calculate the tax credit on the interest earned:
  Tax Credit = Interest Earned × (Tax Credit Rate/100) = 6713.8 × (6.34/100) = 425.66

Step 3: Determine the synergy bonus from energy cost savings:
  Bonus per Year = (Annual Savings / 500) × Synergy Bonus Rate = (1946 / 500) × 45.42 = 176.77
  Total Bonus over 4 years = 176.77 × 4 = 707.1

Step 4: Compute the reinvestment benefit:
  Annual Interest = Interest Earned / Time = 6713.8 / 4 = 1678.45
  Reinvestment Amount per Year = (Reinvestment Percentage/100) × Annual Interest = (13.32/100) × 1678.45 = 223.57
  Reinvestment Benefit = Sum (for each year i from 1 to 4) of [Reinvested Amount × (1 + 0.0518)^(Time - i)] = 966.19

Step 5: Calculate the Total Net Benefit:
  Total Net Benefit = Interest Earned + Tax Credit + Total Bonus + Reinvestment Benefit
                    = 6713.8 + 425.66 + 707.1 + 966.19 = 8812.75

question: Emily White invested in a green bond issued by Tesla for $16248 at an annual coupon rate of 6.61% compounded annually over 4 years. Calculate the total net benefit to the investor, including both the compound interest and the synergy bonus.

Step 4: Calculate the total net benefit:

Furthermore, Walmart achieves annual energy cost savings of $1237, for which the investor gets a synergy bonus of $31.93 per $500 saved each year. Calculate the total net benefit to the investor by summing the compound interest, tax credit, synergy bonus, and reinvestment gains.
solution:
Step 1: Compute the compound interest from the green bond:
  Future Value = 35268 × (1 + 0.0488)^7 = 49229.97
  Interest Earned = Future Value - Principal = 49229.97 - 35268 = 13961.97

Step 2: Calculate the tax credit on the interest earned:
  Tax Credit = Interest Earned × (Tax Credit Rate/100) = 13961.97 × (8.94/100) = 1248.2

Step 3: Determine the synergy bonus from energy cost savings:
  Bonus per Year = (Annual Savings / 500) × Synergy Bonus Rate = (1237 / 500) × 31.93 = 78.99
  Total Bonus over 7 years = 78.99 × 7 = 552.96

Step 4: Compute the reinvestment benefit:
  Annual Interest = Interest Earned / Time = 13961.97 / 7 = 1994.57
  Reinvestment Amount per Year = (Reinvestment Percentage/100) × Annual Interest = (38.86/100) × 1994.57 = 775.09
  Reinvestment Benefit = Sum (for each year i from 1 to 7) of [Reinvested Amount × (1 + 0.0586)^(Time - i)] = 6478.26

Step 5: Calculate the Total Net Benefit:
  Total Net Benefit = Interest Earned + Tax Credit + Total Bonus + Reinvestment Benefit
                    = 13961.97 + 1248.2 + 552.96 + 6478.26 = 22241.39

question: David Brown is evaluating a green bond issued by Tesla with a principal of $26903 and an annual coupon rate of 4.31% compounded annually over 4 years. Due to sustainable finance incentives, the effective interest rate is reduced by 1.71 percentage points. Calculate the financing cost reduction in terms of the difference in compound interest between the original and the discounted rates.
solution:

  Original Interest = 31849.64 - 26903 = 4946.64

Step 2: Adjust the interest rate:

  Adjusted Interest = 29811.93 - 26903 = 2908.93

Step 4: Financing cost reduction:
  Cost Reduction = Original Interest - Adjusted Interest = 4946.64 - 2908.93 = 2037.71

question: Susan Lee invested in a green bond issued by Amazon for $32248 at an annual coupon rate of 5.17% compounded annually over 6 years. In addition, due to sustainable finance benefits, the investor receives a tax credit of 10.11% on the interest earned. Furthermore, Amazon achieves annual energy cost savings of $2316, for which the investor gets a synergy bonus of $22.31 per $500 saved each year. solution:

  Reinvestment Amount per Year = (Reinvestment Percentage/100) × Annual Interest = (13.72/100) × 1898.15 = 260.43

Furthermore, Amazon achieves annual energy cost savings of $4669, for which the investor gets a synergy bonus of $47.05 per $500 saved each year.   Interest Earned = Future Value - Principal = 30684.09 - 24976 = 5708.09

  Annual Interest = Interest Earned / Time = 5708.09 / 6 = 951.35
  Reinvestment Amount per Year = (Reinvestment Percentage/100) × Annual Interest = (42.54/100) × 951.35 = 404.70
  Reinvestment Benefit = Sum (for each year i from 1 to 6) of [Reinvested Amount × (1 + 0.0496)^(Time - i)] = 2749.99

Step 5: Calculate the Total Net Benefit:
  Total Net Benefit = Interest Earned + Tax Credit + Total Bonus + Reinvestment Benefit
                    = 5708.09 + 305.95 + 2636.12 + 2749.99 = 11400.15

question: Mark Smith invested $23553 in a green bond issued by Ford with an annual coupon rate of 4.02% compounded annually over 3 years. Due to sustainable finance policies, the investor receives a tax credit equal to 8.83% of the interest earned. Calculate the net benefit from the tax incentive, which is the sum of the compound interest and the tax credit.
solution:
Step 1: Compute the compound amount and interest earned:
  Future Value = 23553 × (1 + 0.0402)^3 = 26509.21
  Interest Earned = Future Value - Principal = 26509.21 - 23553 = 2956.21

Step 2: Calculate the tax credit:
  Tax Credit = Interest Earned × (Tax Credit Rate/100)
             = 2956.21 × (8.83/100) = 261.03

Step 3: Determine the net benefit:
  Net Benefit = Interest Earned + Tax Credit = 2956.21 + 261.03 = 3217.24

question: John Doe is evaluating a green bond issued by Microsoft with a principal of $16288 and an annual coupon rate of 4.77% compounded annually over 3 years. Due to sustainable finance incentives, the effective interest rate is reduced by 0.79 percentage points. Calculate the financing cost reduction in terms of the difference in compound interest between the original and the discounted rates.
solution:
Step 1: Original calculation:
  Original Future Value = 16288 × (1 + 0.0477)^3 = 18731.76
  Original Interest = 18731.76 - 16288 = 2443.76

Step 2: Adjust the interest rate:
  Adjusted Rate = 4.77 - 0.79 = 3.9799999999999995%

Step 3: Adjusted calculation:
  Adjusted Future Value = 16288 × (1 + 0.0398)^3 = 18311.22
  Adjusted Interest = 18311.22 - 16288 = 2023.22

Step 4: Financing cost reduction:
  Cost Reduction = Original Interest - Adjusted Interest = 2443.76 - 2023.22 = 420.54

question: John Doe invested in a green bond issued by Apple for $44556 at an annual coupon rate of 3.73% compounded annually over 7 years. In addition, due to sustainable finance benefits, the investor receives a tax credit of 8.0% on the interest earned. Furthermore, Apple achieves annual energy cost savings of $2976, for which the investor gets a synergy bonus of $48.91 per $500 saved each year. Moreover, the investor reinvests 42.49% of the annual interest at an additional rate of 6.0% compounded annually. Calculate the total net benefit to the investor by summing the compound interest, tax credit, synergy bonus, and reinvestment gains.
solution:
Step 1: Compute the compound interest from the green bond:
  Future Value = 44556 × (1 + 0.0373)^7 = 57575.38
  Interest Earned = Future Value - Principal = 57575.38 - 44556 = 13019.38

Step 2: Calculate the tax credit on the interest earned:
  Tax Credit = Interest Earned × (Tax Credit Rate/100) = 13019.38 × (8.0/100) = 1041.55

Step 3: Determine the synergy bonus from energy cost savings:
  Bonus per Year = (Annual Savings / 500) × Synergy Bonus Rate = (2976 / 500) × 48.91 = 291.11
  Total Bonus over 7 years = 291.11 × 7 = 2037.79

Step 4: Compute the reinvestment benefit:
  Annual Interest = Interest Earned / Time = 13019.38 / 7 = 1859.91
  Reinvestment Amount per Year = (Reinvestment Percentage/100) × Annual Interest = (42.49/100) × 1859.91 = 790.28
  Reinvestment Benefit = Sum (for each year i from 1 to 7) of [Reinvested Amount × (1 + 0.0600)^(Time - i)] = 6633.45

Step 5: Calculate the Total Net Benefit:
  Total Net Benefit = Interest Earned + Tax Credit + Total Bonus + Reinvestment Benefit
                    = 13019.38 + 1041.55 + 2037.79 + 6633.45 = 22732.17

question: Mark Smith invested in a green bond issued by Walmart for $43585 at an annual coupon rate of 5.34% compounded annually over 5 years. In addition, due to sustainable finance benefits, the investor receives a tax credit of 5.84% on the interest earned. Furthermore, Walmart achieves annual energy cost savings of $1019, for which the investor gets a synergy bonus of $46.97 per $500 saved each year. Moreover, the investor reinvests 41.2% of the annual interest at an additional rate of 5.91% compounded annually. Calculate the total net benefit to the investor by summing the compound interest, tax credit, synergy bonus, and reinvestment gains.
solution:
Step 1: Compute the compound interest from the green bond:
  Future Value = 43585 × (1 + 0.0534)^5 = 56533.21
  Interest Earned = Future Value - Principal = 56533.21 - 43585 = 12948.21

Step 2: Calculate the tax credit on the interest earned:
  Tax Credit = Interest Earned × (Tax Credit Rate/100) = 12948.21 × (5.84/100) = 756.18

Step 3: Determine the synergy bonus from energy cost savings:
  Bonus per Year = (Annual Savings / 500) × Synergy Bonus Rate = (1019 / 500) × 46.97 = 95.72
  Total Bonus over 5 years = 95.72 × 5 = 478.62

Step 4: Compute the reinvestment benefit:
  Annual Interest = Interest Earned / Time = 12948.21 / 5 = 2589.64
  Reinvestment Amount per Year = (Reinvestment Percentage/100) × Annual Interest = (41.2/100) × 2589.64 = 1066.93
  Reinvestment Benefit = Sum (for each year i from 1 to 5) of [Reinvested Amount × (1 + 0.0591)^(Time - i)] = 6003.6

Step 5: Calculate the Total Net Benefit:
  Total Net Benefit = Interest Earned + Tax Credit + Total Bonus + Reinvestment Benefit
                    = 12948.21 + 756.18 + 478.62 + 6003.6 = 20186.6

question: Susan Lee invested in a green bond issued by Microsoft for $17977 at an annual coupon rate of 5.41% compounded annually over 2 years. Additionally, the investor receives a synergy bonus of $14.8 for every $500 saved annually. Calculate the total net benefit to the investor, including both the compound interest and the synergy bonus.
solution:

Step 4: Calculate the total net benefit:

question: Susan Lee purchased a green bond issued by Amazon for $11784. The bond offers an annual yield of 5.38% compounded annually over 3 years. Calculate the total interest earned from this green bond investment.

Furthermore, General Electric achieves annual energy cost savings of $2615, for which the investor gets a synergy bonus of $24.2 per $500 saved each year. Moreover, the investor reinvests 32.13% of the annual interest at an additional rate of 5.42% compounded annually.   Interest Earned = Future Value - Principal = 48986.69 - 41027 = 7959.69

                    = 7959.69 + 456.09 + 632.83 + 2850.11 = 11898.73
